wikipedia_page.main: Roger Lockyer (27 November 1927 – 28 October 2017) was an English historian, academic, and writer. He had been educated at Pembroke College, Cambridge. He was a reader in history at Royal Holloway, University of London for many years, specialising in research and writing on the Tudor (1471-1603) and Stuart (1603-1714) periods.

response: * Roger Lockyer. Buckingham, the Life and Political Career of George Villiers, First Duke of Buckingham, 1592–1628 (Longman, 1981).

Seminar Studies in History was established and edited by history teacher Patrick Richardson of King's College School, Wimbledon.Lockyer, Roger, "Introduction to the series" in  Roger Lockyer of Royal Holloway replaced Patrick Richardson as general editor following Richardson's death in 1979. The current editors are Clive Emsley and Gordon Martel.The Encyclopedia of War. Wiley. Retrieved 6 June 2015.
